name: Standard Essay Rubric
description: General purpose essay evaluation rubric for academic writing

content.name: Content & Ideas
content.description: Quality of ideas, depth of analysis, and relevance to topic

excellent.description: Ideas are insightful, well-developed, and highly relevant. Shows deep understanding and original thinking.

proficient.description: Ideas are clear, well-developed, and relevant. Shows good understanding of the topic.

developing.description: Ideas are present but may lack depth or full development. Some relevance to topic.

beginning.description: Ideas are unclear or underdeveloped. Limited relevance to topic.

inadequate.description: Ideas are absent, unclear, or irrelevant to the topic.

organization.name: Organization & Structure
organization.description: Logical flow, paragraph structure, and overall organization

excellent.description: Clear introduction, logical progression, smooth transitions, strong conclusion.

proficient.description: Good organization with clear structure and adequate transitions.

developing.description: Basic organization present but may lack clarity or smooth flow.

beginning.description: Minimal organization, unclear structure, weak transitions.

inadequate.description: No clear organizational structure or logical flow.

grammar.name: Grammar & Mechanics
grammar.description: Grammar, spelling, punctuation, and sentence structure

excellent.description: Virtually error-free with sophisticated sentence structure.

proficient.description: Minor errors that don't interfere with meaning.

developing.description: Some errors present but meaning is generally clear.

beginning.description: Frequent errors that may interfere with understanding.

inadequate.description: Numerous errors that significantly impede understanding.

style.name: Style & Voice
style.description: Word choice, sentence variety, clarity, and tone

excellent.description: Sophisticated word choice, varied sentence structure, clear voice.

proficient.description: Good word choice and sentence variety, appropriate tone.

developing.description: Adequate word choice, some sentence variety, generally appropriate tone.

beginning.description: Limited word choice, little sentence variety, unclear tone.

inadequate.description: Poor word choice, monotonous sentences, inappropriate tone.

instructions: Use this rubric to evaluate essays across four main criteria. Consider the weight of each criterion when calculating the overall score.
